suggestion: Call reserve() if you know the approximate final size

C++ provides zero-cost abstractions. Understanding move semantics, const correctness, and memory locality can significantly improve performance.

description: Using std::endl flushes buffer unnecessarily
suggestion: Use '\n' instead of std::endl for better performance, or disable iostream sync

C++ Issue: Using std::endl flushes buffer unnecessarily
Recommendation: Use '
' instead of std::endl for better performance, or disable iostream sync

C++ Performance Optimization:
C++ provides zero-cost abstractions. Understanding move semantics, const correctness, and memory locality can significantly improve performance.

description: Dynamic allocation without corresponding delete
suggestion: Use RAII or smart pointers (unique_ptr, shared_ptr) to manage memory automatically
educational_content:
C++ Issue: Dynamic allocation without corresponding delete
Recommendation: Use RAII or smart pointers (unique_ptr, shared_ptr) to manage memory automatically

Memory Management in C++:
C++ uses manual memory management. Following RAII (Resource Acquisition Is Initialization) principle helps prevent memory leaks and ensures exception safety.

description: Class with virtual functions but no virtual destructor
suggestion: Add virtual destructor to base classes with virtual functions
educational_content:
C++ Issue: Class with virtual functions but no virtual destructor
Recommendation: Add virtual destructor to base classes with virtual functions

Memory Management in C++:
C++ uses manual memory management. Following RAII (Resource Acquisition Is Initialization) principle helps prevent memory leaks and ensures exception safety.
